original_comment:
let's gooo, I love this analysis!!! if I can add, Apple hits me so hard as specifically a description of going back to visit your parents as an adult where you've identified/broken patterns of dysfunction but your family hasn't -- e.g. the phrase "apple doesn't fall far from the tree" is almost exclusively used to describe children and their similarity to their parents, the lyrics "i think the apple's rotten right to the core from all the things passed down from all the apples coming before" seems to be referencing something like generational development/trauma, etc. Like the ending of "I know where you go when you're feeling alone, do you? do you? do you?" kind of haunts me fjcjd, it echoes the song's feelings of frustration about reflecting on behaviors of self and others where the other (family members) haven't and keep choosing not to. Hurts good.

(edit: typo)
